meanings.definition: A book containing words, their meanings, and other information
meanings.sent1: I love reading wordbooks to learn new words.
meanings.sent2: She kept all her wordbooks neatly organized on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The wordbooks on the shelf had a party when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a vast wordbook, filled with endless possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The colorful illustrations in the wordbook made learning fun and easy.

meanings.definition: A collection of words or phrases, often organized alphabetically
meanings.sent1: The wordbooks in the library cover a wide range of topics.
meanings.sent2: He used his wordbook to find the meaning of a difficult word.
meanings.sent3: The wordbook on the desk seemed to be whispering secrets to the other books.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a well-organized wordbook, easily accessible at any time.
meanings.sent5: The wordbook was like a treasure chest, full of linguistic gems waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: A reference book for finding definitions and information about words
meanings.sent1: The student consulted his wordbook to understand the unfamiliar term.
meanings.sent2: Wordbooks are essential tools for writers and researchers.
meanings.sent3: The wordbook sat proudly on the shelf, knowing it held all the answers.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge was a powerful wordbook, guiding her through any linguistic challenge.
meanings.sent5: The wordbook was a beacon of light in the sea of unknown words, illuminating the path to understanding.
